Class PieRadarChartBase<T extends ChartData<? extends DataSet<? extends Entry>>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.github.mikephil.charting.charts.Chart<T>
          • com.github.mikephil.charting.charts.PieRadarChartBase<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, ChartInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PieChart, RadarChart

    public abstract class PieRadarChartBase<T extends ChartData<? extends DataSet<? extends Entry>>>
extends Chart<T>
    Baseclass of PieChart and RadarChart.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void calcMinMax()
      calcualtes the y-min and y-max value and the y-delta and x-delta value
      void calculateOffsets()
      calculates the offsets of the chart to the border depending on the position of an eventual legend or depending on the length of the y-axis and x-axis labels and their position
      void computeScroll() 
      float distanceToCenter(float x, float y)
      Returns the distance of a certain point on the chart to the center of the chart.
      float getAngleForPoint(float x, float y)
      returns the angle relative to the chart center for the given point on the chart in degrees.
      float getDiameter()
      returns the diameter of the pie- or radar-chart
      abstract int getIndexForAngle(float angle)
      Returns the xIndex for the given angle around the center of the chart.
      protected android.graphics.PointF getPosition(android.graphics.PointF center, float dist, float angle)
      Calculates the position around a center point, depending on the distance from the center, and the angle of the position around the center.
      abstract float getRadius()
      Returns the radius of the chart in pixels.
      float getRawRotationAngle()
      gets the raw version of the current rotation angle of the pie chart the returned value could be any value, negative or positive, outside of the 360 degrees.
      protected abstract float getRequiredBaseOffset()
      Returns the base offset needed for the chart without calculating the legend size.
      protected abstract float getRequiredLegendOffset()
      Returns the required offset for the chart legend.
      float getRotationAngle()
      gets a normalized version of the current rotation angle of the pie chart, which will always be between 0.0 < 360.0
      java.util.List<SelectionDetail> getSelectionDetailsAtIndex(int xIndex)
      Returns an array of SelectionDetail objects for the given x-index.
      float getYChartMax() 
      float getYChartMin() 
      protected void init()
      initialize all paints and stuff
      boolean isRotationEnabled()
      Returns true if rotation of the chart by touch is enabled, false if not.
      void notifyDataSetChanged()
      Lets the chart know its underlying data has changed and performs all necessary recalculations.
      boolean onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent event) 
      void setRotationAngle(float angle)
      Set an offset for the rotation of the RadarChart in degrees.
      void setRotationEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Set this to true to enable the rotation / spinning of the chart by touch.
      void spin(int durationmillis, float fromangle, float toangle, Easing.EasingOption easing)
      Applys a spin animation to the Chart.

      • notifyDataSetChanged

        public void notifyDataSetChanged()
        Description copied from class: Chart
        Lets the chart know its underlying data has changed and performs all necessary recalculations. It is crucial that this method is called everytime data is changed dynamically. Not calling this method can lead to crashes or unexpected behaviour.
        Specified by:
        notifyDataSetChanged in class Chart<T extends ChartData<? extends DataSet<? extends Entry>>>

      • getAngleForPoint

        public float getAngleForPoint(float x,
                     float y)
        returns the angle relative to the chart center for the given point on the chart in degrees. The angle is always between 0 and 360, 0 is NORTH, 90 is EAST, ...
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:

      • getRawRotationAngle

        public float getRawRotationAngle()
        gets the raw version of the current rotation angle of the pie chart the returned value could be any value, negative or positive, outside of the 360 degrees. this is used when working with rotation direction, mainly by gestures and animations.
        Returns:

      • getRotationAngle

        public float getRotationAngle()
        gets a normalized version of the current rotation angle of the pie chart, which will always be between 0.0 < 360.0
        Returns:

      • setRotationEnabled

        public void setRotationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set this to true to enable the rotation / spinning of the chart by touch. Set it to false to disable it. Default: true
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • isRotationEnabled

        public boolean isRotationEnabled()
        Returns true if rotation of the chart by touch is enabled, false if not.
        Returns:

      • getDiameter

        public float getDiameter()
        returns the diameter of the pie- or radar-chart
        Returns:

      • getRadius

        public abstract float getRadius()
        Returns the radius of the chart in pixels.
        Returns:

      • getRequiredLegendOffset

        protected abstract float getRequiredLegendOffset()
        Returns the required offset for the chart legend.
        Returns:

      • getRequiredBaseOffset

        protected abstract float getRequiredBaseOffset()
        Returns the base offset needed for the chart without calculating the legend size.
        Returns:

      • getYChartMax

        public float getYChartMax()

      • getYChartMin

        public float getYChartMin()

      • getSelectionDetailsAtIndex

        public java.util.List<SelectionDetail> getSelectionDetailsAtIndex(int xIndex)
        Returns an array of SelectionDetail objects for the given x-index. The SelectionDetail objects give information about the value at the selected index and the DataSet it belongs to. INFORMATION: This method does calculations at runtime. Do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Returns:
